events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving their car and requested to file a new insurance claim.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under auto accident due to the reported vehicle collision.
A claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the investigation and settlement process of the auto accident claim.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment receipt to the customer confirming the claim submission and initiation.
Customer was asked to provide the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed.
Customer uploaded all requested documents, including the accident report and multiple images showing the car damage.
The claims agent began a thorough investigation into the circumstances of the auto collision and liability.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of fault and verification of reported damages to the vehicle.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental car reimbursement was proposed to the customer.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed gratitude for the prompt handling of the claim.
The claim was approved officially after customer acceptance of the settlement proposal and all requirements met.
Payment covering the agreed settlement amount was issued directly to the customer's designated bank account.
The insurance claim was formally closed following payment issuance and confirmation that the customer was satisfied.
The claim documentation and files were archived for record keeping and possible future reference.
